DIVISION 1. GENERALLY
Sec. 4-41. Definitions 2:
(Rep. by Ord. 15-16, 5-20-2015)
Sec. 4-41.1. Interpretation 3:
Nothing contained herein shall be deemed to excuse compliance or replace any provision contained in
this chapter, other ordinances of the city of Emporia or laws of the state of Kansas relating to private
clubs. Should any conflict arise concerning the operation of a private club between the provisions of this
article and ordinances or statutes governing class A or B private clubs then the specific provisions
governing a class A or B club shall control. (1962 Code § 4-213; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982)
Sec. 4-42. Private Rooms Or Closed Booths In Retail Establishments 4:
It shall be unlawful to operate private rooms or closed booths at any time in a place of business licensed
for sale of retail cereal malt beverages, but this section shall not apply if the premises is also currently
licensed as a club pursuant to the laws of the state of Kansas. (1962 Code § 4-208; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-
15-1982; Ord. 87-15, § 8, 7-1-1987; Ord. 89-32, § 2, 9-20-1989)
Sec. 4-43. Possession Of Alcoholic Liquor In Retail Establishments 5:
It shall be unlawful for any person to have any alcoholic liquor in his possession or control in a place of
business, unless the premises is currently licensed as a club or drinking establishment pursuant to the
laws of the state of Kansas. (1962 Code § 4-208; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 87-15, § 9, 7-1-1987;
Ord. 89-32, § 3, 9-20-1989)
Sec. 4-44. Offenses Involving Persons Under The Legal Age For Consumption 1:
(a)No licensee, employee or agent of the licensee shall permit a person under the legal age for
consumption, to consume, purchase, or possess any cereal malt beverage in or about a place of
business.
(b)It shall be unlawful for any person or licensee who operates a tavern to allow or permit a person
under eighteen (18) years of age to be present in said tavern while cereal malt beverages are being
dispensed, except as hereinafter provided in subsection (d) of this section, and no person under
eighteen (18) years of age, other than as herein excepted, shall be in or upon the premises of a
tavern while cereal malt beverages are being dispensed.
(c)It shall be unlawful for any person under the legal age for consumption to:
(1) Claim to be the legal age for consumption or more years of age for the purpose of obtaining or
attempting to obtain any cereal malt beverage from any person.
(2) Purchase or obtain or attempt to purchase or obtain any cereal malt beverage from any person.
(3) Possess or consume any cereal malt beverage.
(d)Subsection (b) of this section shall not apply to any person under eighteen (18) years of age who is
accompanied by a person over the legal age for consumption who is the former's parent, legal
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 35/510
guardian or who is related to the former person by marriage. Provided, that this exception shall not
apply where the former person is accompanied by a guardian or spouse unless while present in the
tavern they maintain in their possession current and adequate proof of guardianship or marriage.
(e)No licensee shall employ or permit the employment at the licensee's place of business of any person
under the legal age for consumption in the dispensing, serving or selling of cereal malt beverages.
Provided, however, that such prohibition on employment shall not apply to the employment of
persons eighteen (18) years old or older at the place of business of a limited retailer or the place of
business of a restaurant, licensed per KSA 36-501, which derives not less than fifty percent (50%) of
its gross receipts from the sale of food for consumption on the premises of the licensed place of
business. Any licensee which wishes to be denoted as a restaurant for the purposes of this section
shall verify the same on the person's application for a license as provided in section 4-67 of this
chapter and upon request shall be required to furnish evidence satisfactory in nature and form to the
city manager, as may be requested, demonstrating that the establishment is operating as a
restaurant which derives not less than fifty percent (50%) of its gross receipts from the sale of food
for consumption on the premises of the licensed place of business. Such classification may be
reviewed periodically throughout the license period should information arise to indicate the place of
business is not in fact operating as a restaurant.
(f)Except as otherwise provided herein, the place of business of each general retailer who is required to
secure a license under section 4-66 of this chapter shall be classified as a tavern for the purposes of
this section. Any licensee whose place of business does not conform with the definition of a "tavern"
as provided herein and who does not wish to be classified as such shall, at the time of making
application for a license as provided in section 4-67 of this chapter, additionally verify, on a form
provided by the city clerk, the nature of the business and that said place of business does not
conform to said definition. The licensee shall further be required to furnish evidence satisfactory in
nature and form to the city manager, as may be requested, demonstrating that the establishment is
not operating as a tavern. The classification of such place of business shall be subject to review
periodically throughout the license period should information arise to indicate that the place of
business is in fact operating as a tavern. Any licensee of any licensed establishment who refuses to
comply with the request of the city manager as herein required shall have the classification of the
licensee's place of business reinstated as a tavern.
(g)No person shall knowingly sell, give away, dispose of, exchange or deliver, or permit the sale, gift, or
procuring of any cereal malt beverage to or for any person under the legal age for consumption. No
person over the legal age of consumption shall purchase alcoholic liquor from any person for, or on
behalf of or at the request of any person under the legal age of consumption.
(h)Any person under the legal age for consumption of cereal malt beverages who attempts to purchase
or obtain, purchases, possesses, or consumes cereal malt beverages shall upon conviction thereof,
be punished by a fine of not less than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) and not more than five
hundred dollars ($500.00).
(1) In addition to any other penalty provided for a violation of this section, the court may order the
offender to do either or both of the following:
a. Perform forty (40) hours of public service; or
b. Attend and satisfactorily complete a suitable educational or training program dealing with the
effects of alcohol or other chemical substances when ingested by humans.
(2) Upon a first conviction of a violation of this section, the court shall order the division of vehicles to
suspend the driving privilege of such offender for thirty (30) days. The court shall order that for any
offender who has not been issued a driver's license by the division prior to sentencing of the offender
for a violation of this section, the division shall not issue such offender a driver's license for thirty (30)
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 36/510
days. Upon receipt of the court order, the division shall notify the violator and suspend the driving
privileges of the violator for thirty (30) days whether or not that person has a driver's license.
(3) Upon a second conviction of a violation of this section, the court shall order the division of
vehicles to suspend the driving privilege of such offender for ninety (90) days. Upon receipt of the
court order, the division shall notify the violator and suspend the driving privileges of the violator for
ninety (90) days whether or not that person has a driver's license.
(4) Upon a third or subsequent conviction of a violation of this section, the court shall order the
division of vehicles to suspend the driving privilege of such offender for one year. Upon receipt of the
court order, the division shall notify the violator and suspend the driving privileges of the violator for
one year whether or not that person has a driver's license.
(i)This section shall not apply to the possession and consumption of cereal malt beverage by a person
under the legal age for consumption of cereal malt beverage when such possession and
consumption is permitted and supervised, and such beverage is furnished, by the person's parent or
legal guardian. (1962 Code §§ 4-210, 4-211; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 83-3, § 2, 4-6-1983;
Ord. 85-26, § 1, 7-3-1985; Ord. 87-15, § 11, 7-1-1987; Ord. 87-38, § 2, 12-16-1987; Ord. 89-32, § 4,
9-20-1989; Ord. 01-22, § 1, 6-27-2001; Ord. 04-26, § 1, 7-21-2004)
Sec. 4-44.1. Hours Of Operation:
Each place of business shall be open to the public at all times during business hours and to law
enforcement officers at all times, except that a premises licensed as a club under a license issued
pursuant to the laws of the state of Kansas shall be open to law enforcement officers and not to the
public. (1962 Code § 4-208; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 87-15, § 11, 7-1-1987; Ord. 89-32, § 5, 9-
20-1989)
Sec. 4-44.2. Identification Required In Tavern:
(a)It shall be unlawful for any person to be present in a tavern without having in their possession current
and adequate identification as to proof of age.
(b)The following identification shall be deemed in compliance with the provisions of subsection (a) of this
section:
(1) An unexpired driver's license from any state, so long as it contains the photograph and birth date
of the individual;
(2) An unexpired state issued identification card issued by any state, so long as it contains the
photograph and birth date of the individual;
(3) Any other verifiable identification containing the photograph and birth date of the individual.
(c)A place of business classified as a tavern for purposes of subsection 4-44(f) of this chapter shall be
deemed a tavern for purposes of this section. (Ord. 83-3, § 3, 4-6-1983)
Sec. 4-45. Days And Hours Of Sale Or Consumption 1:
(a)Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, no cereal malt beverage may be sold or
dispensed between the hours of twelve o'clock (12:00) midnight and six o'clock (6:00) A.M., or on
Sunday, except in a place of business which is licensed to sell cereal malt beverage for consumption
on the premises and which derives not less than thirty percent (30%) of its gross receipts from the
sale of food for consumption on the licensed premises.
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 37/510
(b)Cereal malt beverages may be sold on premises which are both licensed hereunder and pursuant to
the club and drinking establishment act under the laws of the state of Kansas, at any time when
alcoholic liquor is allowed by law to be served on the premises.
(c)It shall be unlawful to consume or possess, or for the licensee to permit any person to consume or
possess, any cereal malt beverages at a place of business, except during the period specified herein
for permissible sales and for a period of one-half (1/2) hour thereafter. (1962 Code § 4-208; Ord.
1121, § 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 84-5, § 1, 2-15-1984; Ord. 87-15, § 12, 7-1-1987; Ord. 89-32, § 6, 9-20-
1989; Ord. 94-36, § 2, 8-17-1994)
Sec. 4-46. Lighting:
Any person or licensee operating any place of business selling at retail cereal malt beverages for
consumption on the premises shall provide illumination measuring not less than five (5) foot-candles at a
height of four feet (4') above floor level in the immediate vicinity of any booths, tables or bar or any place
where patrons are served or consume such beverages on the premises. (1962 Code § 4-211; Ord. 1121,
§ 1, 9-15-1982)
Sec. 4-47. Other Restrictions On Delivery, Sale, Transportation Or Consumption 1:
(a)It shall be unlawful to sell, dispense or drink any cereal malt beverage within or upon any public
sidewalk, street, right of way, avenue, alley, parking facility or other public thoroughfare or within any
vehicle upon any such place.
(b)It shall be unlawful to deliver or sell any cereal malt beverage from any drive-up or walk-up window.
(c)All sales and deliveries of cereal malt beverages by a licensee or his employees shall be made only
within the licensed premises.
(d)No person shall sell or furnish cereal malt beverage at retail to any person on credit; on a passbook;
on order on a store; in exchange for any goods, wares, or merchandise; or in payment of any
services rendered. If any person extends credit for such purpose, the debt attempted to be created
shall not be recoverable at law and, in addition, such persons shall be subject to the penalties
provided in this article.
(e)It shall be unlawful to possess, sell, dispense, drink, or consume cereal malt beverages within the
civic auditorium building or its surrounding grounds located between Fifth and Sixth Avenues and
between Market and Mechanic Streets in the city. Provided, however, this prohibition shall not apply
to any portion of the civic auditorium building utilized pursuant to a written agreement with the city of
Emporia which agreement authorizes the possession or consumption of cereal malt beverages.
(f)It shall be unlawful for any person to possess or have in his possession or under his control in or upon
any public street, alley, sidewalk, right of way, avenue, parking facility or thoroughfare (other than in
public parks) within the city any cereal malt beverages unless such beverage is in the original
unopened package or container, the seal of which has not been broken and from which the original
cap, cork or other means of closure has not been removed.
(g)It shall be unlawful for any licensee to receive or store cereal malt beverages at any place other than
the licensee's place of business.
(h)It shall be unlawful for any person to possess, sell, dispense, drink, or consume cereal malt
beverages upon any property owned or leased by a unified school district or on property occupied by
the Emporia recreation commission or its surrounding grounds located between State and Congress
Streets and between Fourth Avenue and the AT&SF Railroad tracks. (1962 Code § 4-209; Ord. 1121,
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 38/510
§ 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 83-12, § 1, 5-4-1983; Ord. 86-41, § 1, 12-17-1986; Ord. 87-15, § 13, 7-1-1987;
Ord. 94-22, § 2, 5-4-1994)
Sec. 4-47.1. Drink Promotions:
(a)No general retailer or club retailer, or employer or agent thereof, licensed to sell cereal malt
beverages for consumption on the licensed premises shall:
(1) Offer or serve any free cereal malt beverage to any person;
(2) Offer or serve to any person a drink at a price that is less than the acquisition cost of the drink to
the licensee;
(3) Sell, offer to sell or serve to any person an unlimited number of drinks during any set period of
time for a fixed price, except at private functions not open to the general public;
(4) Sell, offer to sell or serve any drink to any person at any time at a price less than that charged the
general public on that day, except at private functions not open to the general public;
(5) Increase the size of a drink of a cereal malt beverage without increasing proportionately the price
regularly charged for the drink on that day;
(6) Encourage or permit, on the licensed premises, any game or contest which involves drinking
cereal malt beverage or the awarding of drinks as prizes; or
(7) Advertise or promote in any way, whether on or off the licensed premises, any of the practices
prohibited under subsections (a)(1) through (a)(6) of this section.
(b)Nothing in subsection (a) of this section shall be construed to prohibit a retailer from offering free food
or entertainment at any time.
(c)Every licensee subject to the provisions of this section shall make available at any time upon request
a price list showing the licensee's current prices for all cereal malt beverages.
(d)As used in this section, "drink" means an individual serving of cereal malt beverage. (Ord. 85-26, § 2,
7-3-1985; Ord. 87-15, § 14, 7-1-1987)
Sec. 4-48. Penalty 1:
Any person, whether as principal, agent or employee who violates or aids, abets or participates in the
violation of the provisions of this article for which a penalty is not otherwise specifically provided shall,
upon conviction thereof, be fined a sum not exceeding two thousand five hundred dollars ($2,500.00) or
be confined in jail for a period not exceeding one year, or be both so fined and confined. (1962 Code §
4-214; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 85-26, § 3, 7-3-1985)
Sec. 4-49. Hosting Minors Consuming Alcohol:
(a)Unlawfully hosting minors consuming alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage is recklessly permitting
a person's residence or any land, building, structure or room owned, occupied or procured by such
person to be used by an invitee of such person or an invitee of such person's child or ward, in a
manner that results in the unlawful possession or consumption therein of alcoholic liquor or cereal
malt beverages by a minor.
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 39/510
(b)Unlawfully hosting minors consuming alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage is a class A person
misdemeanor, for which the minimum fine is one thousand dollars ($1,000.00). (Ord. 04-24, § 1, 7-
21-2004; Ord. 12-5, 2-15-2012; Ord. 15-16, 5-20-2015; Ord. 16-05, 3-16-2016)
Secs. 4-50-4-65. Reserved:
DIVISION 2. RETAIL LICENSE 27
Sec. 4-66. Required.
No person shall sell any cereal malt beverage at retail without first having secured a valid license for
each place of business operated within the city. A person licensed to sell only at retail cereal malt
beverages in original and unopened containers and not for consumption on the premises or only for
consumption on the premises shall not sell such beverages in any other manner.
(Code 1962, § 4-202; Ord. No. 1121, § 1, 9-15-82)
State law reference- License required, K.S.A. 41-2702(a).
Sec. 4-67. Application.
Any person desiring a license shall make application therefor in writing to the governing body, through
the city clerk and accompany the application with the required license fee for each place of business for
which the license is applied. The application shall be verified and be upon a form prepared by the
attorney general of the state and shall contain:
(1) The name and residence of the applicant and how long he or she has resided within the State of
Kansas.
(2) The particular place of business for which a license is desired.
(3) The name of the owner of the premises upon which the place of business is located.
(4) The names and addresses of all persons who hold any financial interest in the particular place of
business for which a license is desired.
(5) A statement that the applicant is a citizen of the United States and not less than twenty-one (21)
years of age and that the applicant has not, within two (2) years immediately preceding the date of
making application, been convicted of a felony or any crime involving moral turpitude, or been
adjudged guilty of drunkenness, driving a motor vehicle while under the influence of intoxicating
liquor, or the violation of any other intoxicating liquor law of the state or of the United States.
(6) An accompanying statement, signed by the applicant, authorizing any governmental agency to
provide the city with any information pertinent to the application.
(Code 1962, § 4-204; Ord. No. 1121, § 1, 9-15-82; Ord. No. 88-11, § 2, 5-4-88)
Sec. 4-68. Persons eligible.
If the application is in proper form and accompanied by cash in the amount of the license fee, and if the
applicant is qualified as provided by law, a license shall be issued pursuant to section 4-70 to the
applicant. No license shall be issued to:
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 40/510
(1) A person who is not a resident of the county in which the place of business covered by the license
is located, has not been a resident of such county for at least six (6) months or has not been a
resident in good faith of the State of Kansas.
(2) A person who has not been a resident of this state for at least one year immediately preceding
application for a retailer's license.
(3) A person who is not of good character and reputation in the community in which he resides.
(4) A person who is not a citizen of the United States.
(5) A person who within two (2) years immediately preceding the date of making application has been
convicted of a felony or any crime involving moral turpitude, drunkenness, driving a motor vehicle
while under the influence of intoxicating liquor, or the violation of any other intoxicating liquor law of
any state or of the United States.
(6) A partnership unless all the members of the partnership are otherwise qualified to obtain a
license.
(7) A corporation, if any manager, officer or director thereof, or any stockholder owning in the
aggregate more than twenty-five (25) percent of the stock of such corporation, would be ineligible to
receive a license hereunder for any reason other than citizenship and residency requirements.
(8) A corporation, if any manager, officer or director thereof, or any stockholder owning in the
aggregate more than twenty-five (25) percent of the stock of such corporation has been an officer,
manager or director or a stockholder owning in the aggregate more than twenty-five (25) percent of
the stock of a corporation which:
a. Has had a retailer's license revoked under this article or under K.S.A. 41-2708 and amendments
thereto; or
b. Has been convicted of a violation of the Drinking Establishment Act or the cereal malt beverage
laws of this state or city.
(9) A person whose place of business is conducted by a manager or agent unless said manager or
agent possess all the qualifications of the licensee.
(10) A person whose spouse would be ineligible to receive a retailer's license for any reason other
than citizenship, residence requirements or age, except that this subsection shall not apply in
determining eligibility for a renewal license.
(11) A person whose place of business does not meet the standards of cleanliness prescribed by the
state department of health for such business. A health inspection would not apply to limited retailers
selling cereal malt beverage in original and unopened containers and not for consumption on
premises.
(12) A person whose place of business does not conform to the fire and building standards in effect
in the city.
(13) A person whose place of business does not conform to the zoning regulations for the premises
being licensed.
(14) A person who does not possess a valid license issued pursuant to the club and drinking
establishment act of the state of Kansas and any required licenses of the city for the place of
business if such person is applying for a club retailer's license.
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 41/510
(15) A person, seeking a general retailer's license, whose place of business does not conform to
accepted standards for the protection of the public health, safety and welfare. Factors which may be
considered in making a determination as to such conformity include, but are not limited to, the
character of the business and nearby properties; suitability of the place of business for the sale of
cereal malt beverages; extent of detrimental effects on nearby property; the relative gain to the public
health, safety and welfare from denial of the application as compared to the hardship imposed on the
applicant; and the likely impact on persons under the legal age for consumption. (1962 Code, § 4-
205; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 87-15, § 15, 7-1-1987; Ord. 90-14, § 1, 6-6-1990; Ord. 91-27, §
1, 12-18-1991; Ord. 92-15, § 1, 6-10-1992)
Sec. 4-69. Location; Restrictions:
(a)No retail cereal malt beverage license shall be issued when any portion of a place of business in
which cereal malt beverages are sold, or to be sold, for consumption on the premises is within two
hundred feet (200') of the boundary lines of any property upon which there is located:
(1) Any church; or
(2) Any public or parochial, elementary or secondary school building regularly used for educational
purposes;
unless the licensee has engaged in the business of selling cereal malt beverages or has operated a
club or drinking establishment providing cereal malt beverages at such location prior to a public or
parochial, elementary or secondary school building or church building being placed within the
prescribed distances; or, unless, in the case of a church, where the place of business is also a
restaurant as defined by KSA 41-2601, as amended.
(b)The term "place of business", as used in this section, shall mean the building in which such
beverages are sold or are to be sold.
(c)The distance limitation of subsection (a) of this section shall not apply to any establishment for which
a cereal malt beverage license is requested to be issued by the city when the applicant petitions for
and receives a waiver of the distance limitation from the governing body. The governing body shall
grant such a waiver, in its discretion, only following public notice and hearing, and a finding by the
governing body that the proximity of the particular establishment in question is not adverse to the
public welfare or safety. (1962 Code, § 4-212; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 88-14, § 1, 6-1-1988;
Ord. 91-14, § 1, 9-4-1991)
Sec. 4-70. Issuance:
(a)The city clerk shall issue, to applicants qualified under section 4-68 of this chapter, licenses for a
limited retailer or club retailer, and may issue a general retailer license for taverns in a C-2, C-3 or C-
4 zoning district, restaurants, hotels, motels, or renewals of licenses previously authorized by the
governing body. The governing body shall authorize the issuance by the city clerk of all general
retailer licenses not specifically authorized in this section to be issued by the city clerk.
(b)Failure of the city clerk to issue a license shall cause said application to be taken up at the next
meeting of the governing body for determination of the issuance of said license. If the governing body
votes to issue a license, it shall direct the city clerk to execute and issue the license. (1962 Code, §
4-207; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 91-27, § 2, 12-18-1991; Ord. 92-15, § 2, 6-10-1992)
Sec. 4-71. Fee And Term 1:
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 42/510
(a)The license fee for a club retailer shall be fifty dollars ($50.00) per year for each place of business
where cereal malt beverages are sold for retail consumption on the premises only.
(b)The license fee for the sale of cereal malt beverages in original and unopened containers and not for
consumption on the premises by limited retailers shall be fifty dollars ($50.00) per year for each place
of business where cereal malt beverages are sold.
(c)All licenses shall expire at twelve o'clock (12:00) midnight on December 31 following issuance; and
the full amount of the license fee shall be paid regardless of the time of year in which the license is
issued; provided, however, that a club retailer who has a license to serve alcoholic liquor may apply
for a license issued hereunder at the time of his application for the license to serve alcoholic liquor, in
which event said license shall be valid for a period of one year following issuance.
(d)No part of any license fee paid for any license shall be refunded or rebated for any reason. (1962
Code, § 4-207; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 87-15, § 16, 7-1-1987; Ord. 88-11, § 3, 5-4-1988;
Ord. 08-43, § 1, 12-5-2008)
Sec. 4-72. Transfer:
A license issued pursuant to the provisions of this division shall not be transferable. (1962 Code, § 4-
207; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982)
Sec. 4-73. Form:
A license issued pursuant to the provisions of this division shall state that it is not transferable, and shall
show the calendar year for which it was issued. (1962 Code, § 4-207; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982)
Sec. 4-74. Display:
The license shall be kept posted in a conspicuous place in the place of business. (1962 Code, § 4-207;
Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982)
Sec. 4-74.1. Temporary Cereal Malt Beverage License:
(a)The city shall be authorized to issue a temporary cereal malt beverage license.
(b)Any person desiring a temporary license shall make application therefor in writing to the governing
body through the city clerk and accompany their application with the required license fee. The
application shall be verified and be upon a form prepared by the city clerk and shall contain that
information, as is applicable, as is required by section 4-67 of this division. All applications for
temporary cereal malt beverage licenses shall be made five (5) days prior to the date of the event.
(c)All such temporary licenses shall be valid for a period of eighteen (18) hours as specified in the
license and at the place specified in the application. It shall be unlawful for any person to sell the
cereal malt beverages at any time other than the eighteen (18) hour period specified or at a place
other than as specified in the license application and approved by the governing body.
(d)The fee for a temporary cereal malt beverage license shall be fifty dollars ($50.00).
(e)No more than one temporary cereal malt beverage license shall be issued to any person during any
calendar year.
(f)All provisions of this article not inconsistent with the stated terms of this section shall apply to
temporary cereal malt beverage licenses. No license shall be issued unless all of the criteria for a
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 43/510
license established by this section and otherwise in this article have been met. In addition thereto, no
temporary license shall be issued unless adequate trash receptacles are provided and sanitation
provisions are made. The applicant is responsible for the litter and other material during and after the
event and in addition, the applicant is responsible for demonstrating that adequate parking is
available.
(g)A cash bond shall be required for any temporary cereal malt beverage license issued for a location on
publicly owned property. The city manager shall establish the amount of such bond. (Ord. 83-11, § 1,
5-4-1983; Ord. 84-22, § 1, 6-6-1984; Ord. 87-15, § 17, 7-1-1987; Ord. 94-38, § 1, 8-24-1994)
Sec. 4-75. Revocation Or Suspension; Civil Penalties 28:
(a)The governing body of the city, after at least five (5) days' notice to the persons holding a license
issued under this article, on a date certain, may revoke or suspend such license for any of the
following reasons:
(1) The licensee has fraudulently obtained the license by giving false information in the application
therefor;
(2) The licensee has violated any of the provisions of this article, any rules or regulations made by
the city, or any laws of this state pertaining to the sale of cereal malt beverages;
(3) The licensee has become ineligible to obtain a license under this article;
(4) Drunkenness of the licensee at the licensed premises or permitting any intoxicated or disorderly
person to remain in the licensed premises. For the purposes of this subsection the term
"drunkenness" shall mean that a person's faculties, physical and/or mental, are significantly impaired
by the consumption of alcohol or cereal malt beverages;
(5) The sale or gift of cereal malt beverages to any person under the legal age for consumption of
cereal malt beverage by a licensee, his manager or any employee or agent thereof;
(6) The nonpayment of any license fees;
(7) Permitting any gambling in or upon the licensee's place of business;
(8) Permitting any person to mix drinks with materials purchased in the place of business or brought
in for that purpose unless currently licensed as a private club or drinking establishment pursuant to
the Club and Drinking Establishment Act of the state of Kansas;
(9) Employment of persons under the legal age for consumption in dispensing or selling cereal malt
beverages, except as specifically authorized by this article or the laws of this state;
(10) The employment, or continuation in employment, of a person in connection with the sale, serving
or dispensing of cereal malt beverages if the licensee knows such person has been, within the
preceding two (2) years, adjudged guilty of a felony or of any violation of the intoxicating liquor laws
of this state, another state or the United States;
(11) The sale or possession of, or permitting any person to use or consume on the licensed
premises, any alcoholic liquor, except in a place of business licensed as a private club or drinking
establishment pursuant to the Club and Drinking Establishment Act of the state of Kansas;
(12) Failure to maintain sufficient records to determine the percentage of gross revenues derived
from the sale of cereal malt beverages or for failure to permit the inspection of such records at all
times during business hours by proper agents of the city;
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 44/510
(13) Submission to the governing body by the city manager or his designee of three (3) violations
committed by or permitted by the licensee, or the licensee's agent or employee, within the preceding
year of any statutes or ordinances regulating such business and for which a civil fine was issued. The
provisions of this subsection (a)(13) shall not limit the governing body's ability to suspend or revoke a
license under the other provisions of this section;
(14) The licensee does not maintain the standards of cleanliness and sanitation prescribed by the
State Department of Health for such businesses;
(15) The licensee does not maintain the fire and building standards in effect in the city.
(b)Within twenty (20) days after the order of the governing body revoking or suspending any license, the
licensee may appeal to the district court and the district court shall proceed to hear such appeal as
though such court had original jurisdiction of the matter. Any appeal taken from an order revoking or
suspending the license shall not suspend the order of revocation or suspension during the pendency
of any such appeal. In the case of revocation of the license of any licensee, no new license shall be
issued to the former licensee, or to any person acting for or on the former licensee's behalf for a
period of six (6) months thereafter.
(c)In addition to or in lieu of any other civil or criminal penalty provided by this article, the city manager or
his designee, upon finding that the licensee hereunder has violated any of the provisions of this
article, may impose on such licensee a civil fine not exceeding one thousand dollars ($1,000.00) for
each violation. Such fine shall be imposed pursuant to this section upon written order of the city
manager or his designee to the licensee who committed the violation. Such order shall state the
violation, the fine to be imposed and the right of the licensee to appeal the order. If the licensee is
aggrieved by order of the city manager or his designee the licensee may appeal such order to the
city governing body by filing a notice of appeal with the city clerk. Such notice of appeal must be filed
within fifteen (15) calendar days of the date of the order of the city manager or his designee. At least
five (5) calendar days' notice of the hearing of the appeal by the governing body shall be given to the
licensee. The governing body may upon appeal increase or decrease such civil fine and/or request
commencement of proceeding under subsection (a) of this section. Failure of the licensee to pay any
fine imposed shall be grounds for suspension or revocation of the license.
(d)In any administrative proceeding pursuant to this section, to suspend or revoke a license or to impose
a civil fine, for selling, giving, furnishing, permitting consumption or possession of cereal malt
beverage by a person under the legal age for consumption, it shall be affirmative defense if evidence
is presented which indicates that: 1) the licensee permitted a person under the legal age for
consumption to possess or consume the cereal malt beverage with reasonable cause to believe that
the person was twenty one (21) or more years of age; and 2) to possess or consume the cereal malt
beverage, the person exhibited to the licensee or the licensee's employee, a driver's license, Kansas
nondriver's identification card or other official or apparently official document, containing a
photograph of the person and purporting to establish that such person was twenty one (21) or more
years of age. Evidence necessary to support the affirmative defense shall require more than the oral
testimony of the licensee or the licensee's employee. (1962 Code, § 4-206; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-
1982; Ord. 85-26, § 4, 7-3-1985; Ord. 87-15, § 18, 7-1-1987; Ord. 99-26, § 1, 9-15-1999)
Sec. 4-76. Records Of Action Of Governing Body:
Any action taken by the governing body in issuing, revoking or suspending a license pursuant to the
provisions of this division shall be entered by the city clerk upon the minutes of the proceedings of the
governing body. (1962 Code, § 4-207; Ord. 1121, § 1, 9-15-1982; Ord. 91-27, § 3, 12-18-1991)
Sec. 4-77. Kansas Department Of Revenue Stamp:
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 45/510
(a)Each license issued pursuant to the provisions of this article shall have affixed to it a Kansas
Department of Revenue stamp and no retailer's license shall be issued or renewed unless and until
said stamp has first been affixed thereto.
(b)Each applicant for a retailer's license, or renewal of such license, shall submit at the time of making
application, in addition to any license fee, a fee of twenty five dollars ($25.00) for the revenue stamp
provided under subsection (a) of this section.
(c)All fees collected by the city clerk pursuant to the provisions of this subsection shall be remitted by the
clerk, along with a copy of the completed application of the licensee to the Kansas Department of
Revenue, Division of Alcoholic Beverage Control, at such times and in the manner as required by the
Director of Alcoholic Beverage Control.
(d)This section shall take effect on January 1, 1988.
(Ord. No. 87-38, § 3, 12-16-87)

ARTICLE IV. PRIVATE CLUBS 29
DIVISION 1. GENERALLY
Sec. 4-91. Definitions.
The definitions in K.S.A. 41-2601, as amended, shall apply to this article.
(Ord. No. 87-15, § 19, 7-1-87)
Sec. 4-92. Presence of certain persons in Class B private clubs.
(a)No Class B private club shall knowingly, or unknowingly, admit any person under eighteen (18) years
of age to be in or upon its premises at any time alcoholic liquor is being dispensed or to knowingly or
unknowingly, admit any person under the age of twenty-one (21) years of age to be in or upon its
premises between the hours of 12:00 midnight and 2:00 a.m., except any person who is an employee
or an agent hired under contract by such club, or unless such person is accompanied by his parent
or guardian and no person under eighteen (18) years of age, shall be in or upon the premises of a
Class B private club at any time alcoholic liquor is being dispensed and no person under twenty-one
(21) years of age shall be in or upon the premises of a Class B private club between the hours of
12:00 midnight and 2:00 a.m., other than as herein excepted.
(b)The owner of any Class B private club, any officer, agent, or employee thereof who shall permit any
person to be in or upon the premises of a club in violation of subsection (a), shall be guilty of a Class
C misdemeanor.
(c)Violation of subsection (a) by a person under twenty-one (21) years of age is a misdemeanor
punishable by a fine of not less than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) nor more than five hundred
dollars ($500.00). In addition to such fine, the court may order the defendant to perform forty (40)
hours of public service.
(Ord. No. 840, § 1, 7-6-77; Ord. No. 87-15, § 20, 7-1-87; Ord. No. 87-38, § 4, 12-16-87)
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 46/510
Sec. 4-93. Consumption of liquor or cereal malt beverages by persons under
twenty-one.
(a)No licensee or permit holder, or any owner, officer, or employee thereof, shall knowingly or
unknowingly permit the consumption of alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages by any person
under twenty-one (21) years of age on premises where alcoholic beverages are sold by such
licensee or permit holder and no person under twenty-one (21) years of age shall consume or
attempt to consume any alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage while in or upon such premises.
(b)Violation of this section by a person less than twenty-one (21) years of age is a misdemeanor
punishable by a fine of not less than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) nor more than five hundred
dollars ($500.00). In addition to such fine, the court may order the defendant to perform forty (40)
hours of public service.
(c)Any person violating any of the provisions of this section for which the penalty is not otherwise
provided, shall be guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by a fine of not less than one hundred dollars
($100.00) and not more than two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) or confined in jail for a period not
exceeding thirty (30) days, or be both so fined and confined.
(Code 1962, § 4-308; Ord. No. 840, § 1, 7-6-77; Ord. No. 87-15, § 21, 7-1-87; Ord. No. 87-38, § 5, 12-
16-87).
State law reference- Similar provisions, K.S.A. 41-2615.
Sec. 4-94. Penalty.
Any person who violates or aids, abets or participates in the violation of any of the provisions of this
article for which another penalty is not specifically provided shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon
conviction thereof, shall be fined a sum not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00) or be confined in
jail for a period not to exceed six (6) months, or be both so fined and confined.
(Code 1962, § 4-310; Ord. No. 840, § 1, 7-6-77)
State law reference- Penalty for violation of state act regulating clubs, K.S.A. 41-2633.
Secs. 4-95-4-104. Reserved.
DIVISION 2. DRINKING ESTABLISHMENTS, CLUBS, CATERERSLICENSE
30
Sec. 4-105. License required.
It shall be unlawful for any person granted a drinking establishment, private club or caterer license by the
State of Kansas to sell or serve any alcoholic liquor authorized by such license within the city without
first obtaining a city license.
(Ord. No. 88-11, § 4, 5-4-88)
Sec. 4-106. License fee, application, issuance and term.
(a)There is hereby levied an annual license fee in the amount of two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) on
each Class A club, Class B club, drinking establishment, or caterer located in the city which has a
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 47/510
Class A club, Class B club, drinking establishment or caterer license issued by the state director of
alcoholic beverage control, which fee must be paid at the time of application for a city license.
(b)All applications for new or renewal city licenses shall be submitted to the city clerk, upon a form
prepared by the city clerk. If the application is in proper form and accompanied by cash in the amount
of the license fee, the city clerk of the city shall, if the applicant is qualified by law and if there are no
conflicts with any zoning, building, alcoholic beverage or other ordinances of the city, or with any of
the reports issued pursuant to the provisions of section 4-107 of this article, issue a city license for
the period covered by the state license; provided, however, that no license shall be effective until the
applicant has been issued an appropriate license by the director of alcoholic beverage control of the
State of Kansas.
(c)Failure of the city clerk to issue a license as provided by subsection (b) shall cause said application to
be taken up at the next meeting of the governing body for determination of the issuance of said
license.
(d)The license period shall extend for the period covered by the state license. The full amount of the fee
shall be paid regardless of the time of year in which the license is issued and no license fee shall be
refunded for any reason.
(e)Every licensee shall cause the city license to be placed in plain view next to or below the state license
in a conspicuous place on the licensed premises.
(Ord. No. 88-11, § 4, 5-4-88)
State law reference- License fee, K.S.A. 41-2622.
Sec. 4-107. Restriction on location.
(a)No alcoholic liquor shall be sold or served by a person holding a license or permit from the city when
any portion of the place of business in which alcoholic liquor is to be sold is within two hundred (200)
feet of the boundary lines of any property upon which there is located:
(1) Any church; or
(2) Any public or parochial, elementary or secondary school building regularly used for educational
purposes;
unless the licensee has engaged in the business of selling alcoholic liquor or has operated an
establishment providing alcoholic liquor at such location prior to a public or parochial, elementary or
secondary school building or church building being placed within the prescribed distances; or, unless,
in the event of a church, when the place of business is also a restaurant.
(b)The term "place of business," as used in this section, shall mean the building in which such
beverages are sold or are to be sold.
(c)The distance limitation of subsection (a) above shall not apply to a club, drinking establishment,
caterer, or temporary permit holder when the license or permit applicant petitions for and receives a
waiver of the distance limitation from the governing body. The governing body shall grant such a
waiver, in its discretion, only following public notice and hearing and a finding by the governing body
that the proximity of the particular establishment in question is not adverse to the public welfare or
safety.
(d)No license or permit shall be issued for the sale of alcoholic liquor if the building does not meet the
zoning ordinance requirements of the city or conflicts with other city ordinances, including, without
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 48/510
limitation, building codes.
(e)Before any license as required by this article is issued, the premises shall be inspected by the chief of
police, the county health department, the fire chief, the building official or a representative thereof,
who shall report to the city clerk in writing. The license application shall be refused if reasonable
requirements as to health, sanitation, fire protection, construction and policing are not met.
(Ord. No. 88-11, § 4, 5-4-88; Ord. No. 91-14, § 2, 9-4-91)
Sec. 4-108. Business regulations.
(a)The city license issued hereunder shall allow the licensee to operate only at the premises specified in
such license in accordance with the provisions of this article, the laws of the state, and the rules and
regulations adopted by the director of alcoholic beverage control of the department of revenue.
(b)No drinking establishment or private club licensed hereunder shall allow the serving, mixing, or
consumption of alcoholic liquor on its premises between the hours of 2:00 a.m. and 9:00 a.m. on any
day.
(c)No caterer licensed hereunder shall allow the serving, mixing, or consumption of alcoholic liquor
between the hours of 2:00 a.m. and 6:00 a.m. on any day.
(d)No alcoholic beverages or cereal malt beverages shall be given, sold, or traded to any person under
twenty-one (21) years of age.
(Ord. No. 88-11, § 4, 5-4-88)
Sec. 4-109. Notice to chief of police.
Prior to any event in which a caterer will sell or serve alcoholic liquor by the individual drink, the caterer
shall provide written notice to the chief of police at least forty-eight (48) hours prior to the event, if the
event will take place within the city. The notice shall contain the location, name of the group sponsoring
the event, and the exact date and time the caterer will be serving.
(Ord. No. 88-11, § 4, 5-4-88)
Sec. 4-110. Penalty.
If the licensee has violated any of the provisions of this article, or if the licensee's state license has been
revoked or suspended by the director of alcoholic beverage control of the state department of revenue,
the governing body of the city, upon five (5) days' written notice to the person holding such license to sell
alcoholic liquor, may permanently revoke or cause to be suspended for a period of not more than thirty
(30) days, such license and the individual holding the license may be charged in the municipal court with
a violation of the alcoholic liquor laws of the city and upon conviction shall be punished by a fine of not
more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisonment for not more than six (6) months or be both so
fined and confined. (Ord. 88-11, § 4, 5-4-1988)
Secs. 4-111-4-115. Reserved:
DIVISION 3. TEMPORARY PERMITS
Sec. 4-116. Permit Required:
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 49/510
It shall be unlawful for any person granted a temporary permit by the state of Kansas to sell or serve any
alcoholic liquor within the city without first obtaining a local, temporary permit from the city clerk.
"Temporary permits" for the purpose of this division shall be defined as a permit, issued in accordance
with the laws of the state of Kansas, which allows the permit holder to offer for sale, sell and serve
alcoholic liquor for consumption on unlicensed premises, open to the public. (Ord. 88-11, § 5, 5-4-1988)
Sec. 4-117. Permit Fee:
(a)There is hereby levied a temporary permit fee in the amount of twenty five dollars ($25.00) per day on
each group or individual holding a temporary permit issued by the state director of alcoholic beverage
control authorizing sales within the city, which fee shall be paid before the event is begun under the
state permit.
(b)Every temporary permit holder shall cause a temporary permit receipt to be placed in plain view on
any premises within the city where the holder of the temporary permit is serving or mixing alcoholic
liquor for consumption on the premises.
(c)The permit period shall extend for the period covered by the state temporary permit. No city
temporary permit fee shall be refunded for any reason. (Ord. 88-11, § 5, 5-4-1988)
Sec. 4-118. City Temporary Permit:
(a)It shall be unlawful for any person to conduct an event under a state issued temporary permit without
first applying for a local temporary permit at least five (5) days before the event. Written application
for the local temporary permit shall be made to the city clerk and shall clearly state:
(1) The name of the applicant;
(2) The group for which the event is planned;
(3) The location of the event;
(4) The date and time of the event; and
(5) Any anticipated need for police, fire, or other municipal services.
(b)Upon presentation of a state temporary permit, payment of the city's temporary permit fee and a
written application as provided for in subsection (a) of this section, the city clerk shall issue a local
temporary permit to the applicant provided that there are no conflicts with any zoning, building, or
other ordinances of the city or with the reports as required by section 4-107 of this chapter. Failure of
the city clerk to issue such permit shall cause the permit's issuance to be referred to the governing
body at their next official public meeting for determination.
(c)The city clerk shall notify the chief of police whenever a temporary permit has been issued and
forward a copy of the permit and application to the chief of police. (Ord. 88-11, § 5, 5-4-1988)
Sec. 4-119. Permit Regulations:
(a)No temporary permit holders shall allow the serving, mixing, or consumption of alcoholic liquor or
CMB between the hours of two o'clock (2:00) A.M. and six o'clock (6:00) A.M. for any event for which
a temporary permit has been issued.
(b)A temporary permit shall allow the permittee to operate at only the premises specified in such permit
in accordance with the provisions of this article, the laws of the state, and the rules and regulations of
1/15/2020 Code Book Viewer
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/KS/Emporia/index.htm 50/510
the director of alcoholic beverage control. Such premises shall be open to law enforcement officers at
all times that alcoholic liquor or CMB is being served, mixed or consumed on such premises.
(c)Each person or group issued a temporary permit shall ensure that adequate trash receptacles and
sanitary provisions are provided and made. The applicant is responsible for the litter and other
material during and after the event and in addition, the applicant is responsible for demonstrating that
adequate parking is available.
(d)Except as otherwise provided herein, the permit shall be issued for a period of time not to exceed
three (3) consecutive days, the dates and hours of which shall be specified in the permit. Not more
than four (4) temporary permits may be issued to any one applicant during a calendar year. A
temporary permit for a special event approved by the governing body may be issued for the entire
period of such special event, but in no event shall such permit be issued for a period of time that
exceeds thirty (30) consecutive days.
(e)A temporary permit may be issued for the consumption of alcoholic liquor or CMB on a city street,
alley, road, sidewalk or highway for a special event; provided, that such street, alley, road, sidewalk
or highway is closed to motor vehicle traffic by the governing body for such special event, a written
request for such consumption and possession of such alcoholic liquor or CMB has been made to the
governing body and the special event is approved by the governing body by ordinance. The
boundaries of such special event shall be clearly marked by signs, a posted map or other means
which reasonably identify the area in which alcoholic liquor may be possessed or consumed at such
special event.
(f)Drinking establishments that are immediately adjacent to, or located within the licensed premises of a
special event, for which a temporary permit has been issued and the consumption of alcoholic liquor
on public property has been approved, may request that the drinking establishment's licensed
premises be extended into and made a part of the licensed premises of the special event for the
duration of the temporary permit issued for such special event.
(g)Each licensee selling alcoholic liquor or CMB for consumption on the premises of a special event for
which a temporary permit has been issued shall be liable for violations of all laws governing the sale
and consumption of alcoholic liquor.
(h)Temporary permits shall not be transferable or assignable.
(i)Cash bonds shall be required for any temporary permit issued for a location on publicly owned
property. The city manager shall establish the amount of such bond. (Ord. 88-11, § 5, 5-4-1988; Ord.
12-20, 7-18-2012)
Sec. 4-120. Penalty:
If the permit holder has violated any of the provisions of this article, the governing body shall revoke
such a temporary permit, and the individual holding the permit may be charged in municipal court with
the violation of the alcoholic liquor laws of the city and upon conviction shall be punished by a fine of not
more than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisonment for not more than six (6) months, or be both
so fined and confined. (Ord. 88-11, § 5, 5-4-1988)
